> The create() method itself is fairly straight
> forward. It's just a few setString() and executeQuery(). I don't 
know if it
> worth the effort to mock the infrastructure to test these few 
statements really
> got executed.

We don't use the database directly. We use the create feature of the 
framework we use. And that framework uses EJB and CMP to persist the 
object.

> P.S. For some reason my mails to this list only get listed after I 
sent it for
> 2 days. This make the conversion not very interactive. Does anyone 
has this
> problem?

My postings are sent after half a day or sometimes after one day.

I don't like it that every posting is read before it is published in 
this forum. This is not necessary. Imagine Sun doing this in their 
forum. They don't need that censorship nor does this forum need it. 
It has only disadvantages.
